question.text: What share of global energy will come from renewable sources in 2050?

config.context: Current renewable share: ~15% (2024). Paris targets: 60-70% by 2050. Key uncertainties: policy ambition, battery/storage costs, grid infrastructure, fossil fuel phase-out pace, nuclear expansion.

signals.text: Will renewable energy exceed 55% of global electricity generation before 2030, according to Our World in Data?
signals.reasoning: Energy transitions fundamentally reshape entire economies through infrastructure investment, job creation/destruction, and productivity changes across all sectors

signals.text: Ragnarök Question Series: If a global catastrophe occurs, will it be due to either human-made climate change or geoengineering?
signals.reasoning: Global catastrophes from climate change would cause massive economic collapse and GDP destruction

signals.text: Will North and South Korea be at war before 2050, according to WPR?
signals.reasoning: War between major economies would significantly disrupt global trade, supply chains, and economic growth through military spending and reconstruction costs.

signals.text: Fed increases interest rates by 25+ bps after July 2025 meeting?
signals.reasoning: Federal Reserve policy directly affects borrowing costs, investment, consumption, and overall economic growth - a primary driver of GDP.

signals.text: By 2028, will there be a visible break in trend line on US GDP, GDP per capita, unemployment, or productivity, which most economists attribute directly to the effects of AI?
signals.reasoning: This question directly measures AI's impact on GDP metrics and economic productivity - exactly what affects GDP by 2040.

signals.text: Will China, Russia, the U.S., or the EU publicly announce new economic or trade sanctions that specifically target a state-owned oil or gas entity in Egypt, Jordan, or the United Arab Emirates (UAE) by 30 June 2026?
signals.reasoning: Trade sanctions and energy market disruptions directly affect international trade flows, energy prices, and economic growth.

signals.text: By December 2027, battery storage costs fall below $50/kWh at utility scale, per BloombergNEF annual battery price survey
signals.reasoning: This threshold would make renewable energy fully dispatchable and cost-competitive with fossil fuels everywhere. Storage is the key bottleneck preventing higher renewable penetration.

signals.text: By January 2027, US federal clean energy tax credits are extended beyond 2032, per Congressional Budget Office scoring of enacted legislation
signals.reasoning: Policy continuity is crucial for renewable investment decisions with 10+ year payback periods. Extension would unlock massive private capital deployment in world's second-largest energy market.

signals.text: Before December 2028, perovskite-silicon tandem solar cells achieve >35% commercial efficiency, per NREL certification
signals.reasoning: Would represent a breakthrough making solar dramatically more space-efficient and cost-effective. Could accelerate deployment in land-constrained regions and make distributed solar more attractive.

signals.text: By March 2027, Russia's energy export revenues fall below $100 billion annually, per Russian Federal Customs Service data
signals.reasoning: Would indicate successful decoupling from Russian fossil fuels post-Ukraine conflict. Accelerated European renewable deployment to replace Russian gas would significantly boost global renewable share.

signals.text: By December 2026, electric vehicle sales exceed 50% of new car sales in at least 10 countries, per EV-Volumes.com data
signals.reasoning: Transport electrification drives electricity demand, creating market pull for renewable generation. Widespread EV adoption would significantly increase the electricity sector's share of total energy.

signals.text: By December 2027, heat pumps achieve >40% market share of new residential heating systems in cold climate regions (US Northeast, Northern Europe), per industry association data
signals.reasoning: Building heating is a major energy end-use. Heat pump adoption would electrify heating demand, increasing renewable electricity's share of total energy consumption.

signals.text: Before January 2028, natural gas prices remain above $8/MMBtu Henry Hub for 12 consecutive months, per NYMEX futures settlements
signals.reasoning: Sustained high gas prices would make renewable electricity more cost-competitive. Would accelerate utility switching from gas to renewables for power generation.

signals.text: Before December 2028, climate damages from extreme weather exceed $200 billion annually in insurance claims globally, per Munich Re NatCatSERVICE database
signals.reasoning: Would increase political and economic pressure for rapid decarbonization. Could trigger emergency renewable deployment programs and carbon pricing mechanisms globally.

scenarios.name: Green Acceleration
scenarios.description: Renewable energy technologies achieve breakthrough cost reductions and performance improvements, accelerated by climate urgency and supportive policy. Energy storage costs plummet, solar efficiency soars, and electrification spreads rapidly across transport and heating. Renewable share reaches 65-75% by 2050.
key_drivers: Rapid electrification of transport and heating
scenarios.why_exclusive: Cannot co-occur with scenarios where renewable adoption is slow or fossil fuel transitions are delayed, as it represents the high end of the renewable transition speed spectrum.
signals_from_clusters: Will renewable energy exceed 55% of global electricity generation before 2030
By December 2027, battery storage costs fall below $50/kWh
Before December 2028, perovskite-silicon tandem solar cells achieve >35% commercial efficiency
By December 2026, electric vehicle sales exceed 50% of new car sales in at least 10 countries
By December 2027, heat pumps achieve >40% market share

scenarios.name: Gradual Transition
scenarios.description: Renewable energy grows steadily but faces persistent challenges from grid integration, storage costs, and policy inconsistency. Progress occurs but at a measured pace, with fossil fuels maintaining significant market share. Renewable share reaches 45-55% by 2050.
key_drivers: Steady but not dramatic cost reductions
scenarios.why_exclusive: Cannot co-occur with either rapid acceleration or stagnation scenarios, as it represents the middle range of transition speeds where progress is steady but not transformative.
signals_from_clusters: Fed increases interest rates by 25+ bps after July 2025
By 2028, will there be a visible break in trend line on US GDP attributed to AI effects

scenarios.name: Fossil Lock-In
scenarios.description: Energy transition stalls due to technological setbacks, policy reversals, and continued fossil fuel competitiveness. High gas prices make renewables relatively attractive but grid constraints and storage challenges limit deployment. Renewable share reaches only 30-40% by 2050.
scenarios.why_exclusive: Cannot co-occur with scenarios showing rapid renewable growth, as it represents the low end of the transition spectrum where structural and economic barriers prevent faster adoption.
signals_from_clusters: Before January 2028, natural gas prices remain above $8/MMBtu for 12 consecutive months
By March 2027, Russia's energy export revenues fall below $100 billion annually

scenarios.name: Crisis-Driven Collapse
scenarios.description: Global economic and political instability from climate catastrophes, wars, or financial crises severely disrupts energy systems and investment. Energy security concerns override climate goals, leading to fragmented and inefficient energy systems. Renewable share struggles to reach 25-35% by 2050.
key_drivers: Focus on energy security over efficiency
scenarios.why_exclusive: Cannot co-occur with stable growth scenarios as it represents a fundamentally different world state where crisis response dominates long-term planning and investment.
signals_from_clusters: Ragnarök Question Series: global catastrophe due to climate change or geoengineering
Before December 2028, climate damages exceed $200 billion annually in insurance claims
Will North and South Korea be at war before 2050
Will China, Russia, the U.S., or the EU announce sanctions targeting oil/gas entities

mece_reasoning: These four scenarios are MECE because they partition the outcome space along two key dimensions: (1) the speed/success of renewable energy transition (fast/medium/slow/disrupted) and (2) the stability of the global system (stable growth vs crisis). They cannot co-occur because they represent mutually exclusive states of the same underlying variables - you cannot simultaneously have both rapid renewable acceleration and fossil fuel lock-in, or both stable economic growth and crisis-driven collapse. Together they cover the full spectrum from optimistic breakthrough scenarios to pessimistic crisis scenarios, with realistic middle-ground outcomes included.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: Will renewable energy exceed 55% of global electricity generation before 2030, according to Our World in Data?

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Achieving 55% renewables by 2030 indicates rapid deployment aligned with breakthrough cost reductions and supportive policies, strongly supporting this scenario.
Could be consistent with steady growth trajectory, but the 2030 timeline is aggressive for gradual transition, making this less discriminating.
Rapid renewable adoption contradicts the premise of stalled transition due to technological setbacks and fossil fuel competitiveness.
High renewable penetration by 2030 suggests stable investment environment and energy system deployment, inconsistent with disrupted investment.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: Ragnarök Question Series: If a global catastrophe occurs, will it be due to either human-made climate change or geoengineering?

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Climate-driven catastrophe doesn't directly inform about renewable energy acceleration - could occur regardless of energy transition speed.
Climate catastrophe is orthogonal to the pace of renewable transition - could happen with gradual or fast transitions.
Climate catastrophe somewhat more likely if fossil fuel lock-in prevents adequate decarbonization, but signal doesn't directly measure energy mix.
Climate catastrophe is one of the disrupting factors mentioned in this scenario that could severely disrupt energy systems and investment.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: Will North and South Korea be at war before 2050, according to WPR?

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Major regional war would disrupt global supply chains, investment flows, and policy focus needed for rapid renewable energy acceleration.
War would create headwinds for steady renewable growth but wouldn't necessarily derail gradual progress completely.
Geopolitical instability and war priorities could delay renewable investments and maintain fossil fuel dependence for energy security.
Major war is exactly the type of global political instability that would severely disrupt energy systems and investment in this scenario.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: Fed increases interest rates by 25+ bps after July 2025 meeting?

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Higher interest rates increase capital costs for renewable energy projects, potentially slowing deployment, though effect is moderate.
Modest rate increase has limited impact on long-term renewable trends in a gradual transition scenario.
Higher borrowing costs could delay renewable projects and maintain fossil fuel competitiveness, supporting this scenario.
Single rate decision is minor compared to the systemic disruptions envisioned in crisis-driven collapse.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: By 2028, will there be a visible break in trend line on US GDP, GDP per capita, unemployment, or productivity, which most economists attribute directly to the effects of AI?

scenario_mappings.reasoning: AI productivity breakthroughs could accelerate renewable technology development, grid optimization, and reduce costs, supporting rapid transition.
AI impacts could modestly help renewable deployment but wouldn't fundamentally change gradual transition trajectory.
AI-driven productivity growth could overcome some barriers to renewable deployment, making fossil lock-in less likely.
Significant AI productivity gains suggest economic stability and technological progress, contradicting crisis-driven collapse scenario.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: Will China, Russia, the U.S., or the EU publicly announce new economic or trade sanctions that specifically target a state-owned oil or gas entity in Egypt, Jordan, or the United Arab Emirates (UAE) by 30 June 2026?

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Sanctions on Middle East energy entities are geopolitically specific and don't directly drive renewable acceleration globally.
Regional sanctions have minimal impact on global renewable energy transition pace.
Energy sector sanctions could disrupt oil/gas markets and potentially strengthen fossil fuel incumbents elsewhere.
Major power sanctions indicate geopolitical tensions that could contribute to broader instability affecting energy systems.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: By December 2027, battery storage costs fall below $50/kWh at utility scale, per BloombergNEF annual battery price survey

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Breakthrough battery cost reduction is a key enabling technology for renewable acceleration, directly addressing grid integration challenges.
Lower storage costs help renewable deployment but within existing gradual trajectory rather than accelerating beyond it.
Cheap storage solves a major renewable weakness, making fossil fuel lock-in much less likely by improving renewable competitiveness.
Achieving breakthrough battery costs suggests continued technological progress and supply chain stability, inconsistent with collapse scenario.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: By January 2027, US federal clean energy tax credits are extended beyond 2032, per Congressional Budget Office scoring of enacted legislation

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Extended tax credits provide policy certainty and financial support that strongly enables rapid renewable deployment acceleration.
Policy support helps maintain steady renewable growth trajectory but doesn't necessarily accelerate beyond gradual pace.
Continued clean energy subsidies directly contradict the policy reversals and lack of support assumed in fossil lock-in scenario.
Successful policy extension suggests political stability and functioning institutions, somewhat inconsistent with crisis-driven collapse.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: Before December 2028, perovskite-silicon tandem solar cells achieve >35% commercial efficiency, per NREL certification

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Breakthrough solar efficiency represents exactly the technological advance that would drive cost reductions and accelerate renewable deployment.
Improved solar technology helps renewable growth but may be absorbed within existing gradual deployment trajectory.
Major solar efficiency breakthrough contradicts technological setbacks premise and would improve renewable competitiveness against fossils.
Achieving advanced solar technology suggests continued R&D progress and industrial capability, inconsistent with systemic collapse.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: By March 2027, Russia's energy export revenues fall below $100 billion annually, per Russian Federal Customs Service data

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Declining fossil fuel revenues from major producer suggests successful global shift to renewables reducing demand for oil/gas exports.
Reduced Russian energy revenues consistent with steady renewable growth reducing fossil fuel demand, though could have other causes.
If fossil fuels remained competitive and dominant, major producer revenues wouldn't decline this significantly without other disruptions.
Collapsed Russian energy revenues could indicate broader geopolitical instability and economic disruption affecting global energy markets.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: By December 2026, electric vehicle sales exceed 50% of new car sales in at least 10 countries, per EV-Volumes.com data

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Rapid EV adoption in multiple countries signals breakthrough cost reductions and supportive policies, core elements of green acceleration scenario.
50% EV share in 10 countries by 2026 represents faster-than-gradual progress, suggesting acceleration beyond this moderate scenario.
Widespread EV adoption directly contradicts fossil fuel lock-in scenario by demonstrating successful displacement of ICE vehicles.
High EV adoption requires stable supply chains and consumer confidence, inconsistent with economic/political collapse scenario.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: By December 2027, heat pumps achieve >40% market share of new residential heating systems in cold climate regions (US Northeast, Northern Europe), per industry association data

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Heat pump breakthroughs in challenging cold climates indicate technological improvements and policy support driving electrification.
40% heat pump adoption could align with steady progress but is somewhat aggressive for gradual scenario timeline.
Significant heat pump adoption displaces gas heating systems, contradicting fossil fuel competitiveness assumption.
Major heating system transitions require stable construction markets and financing, unlikely during crisis-driven collapse.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: Before January 2028, natural gas prices remain above $8/MMBtu Henry Hub for 12 consecutive months, per NYMEX futures settlements

scenario_mappings.reasoning: High gas prices accelerate renewable competitiveness and create economic pressure for clean energy investment.
Elevated gas prices support renewable adoption but may not be sufficient alone to drive acceleration beyond gradual pace.
Persistently high gas prices undermine the fossil fuel competitiveness that defines this scenario.
High gas prices could result from supply disruptions during geopolitical crises or economic instability.

signal_scenario_matrix.signal: Before December 2028, climate damages from extreme weather exceed $200 billion annually in insurance claims globally, per Munich Re NatCatSERVICE database

scenario_mappings.reasoning: Severe climate damages create urgent pressure for rapid decarbonization and mobilize resources for green transition.
Extreme climate damages suggest urgency that pushes beyond gradual pace toward either acceleration or system disruption.
Massive climate damages make continued fossil fuel dependence politically and economically untenable.
$200B+ annual climate damages indicate the scale of catastrophic disruption that could trigger economic and political instability.
